node.title: The Fastest NuGet Package Ever Published (Probably)
node.description: The fastest way to create a new NuGet package project and get it published with all the bells and whistles like continuous integration (CI) builds and drafted release notes.

node.title: The Easiest Way to Version NuGet Packages
node.description: Using MinVer is the easiest way to version your NuGet packages and DLL's using semantic versioning (SemVer).

node.title: What dotnet new Could Be
node.description: What the 'dotnet new' CLI command could be if some effort was spent on developing it. I compare it to other templating engines and suggest ideas.

node.title: Unit Testing dotnet new Templates
node.description: It's difficult to know if your 'dotnet new' based project will work if they have lots of options, in this post I show how to unit test them.

node.title: Cross-Platform DevOps for .NET Core
node.description: Learn how to use Cake, AppVeyor and Travis CI continuous integration build systems to perform cross-platform DevOps for .NET Core based projects.

node.title: Custom Project Templates Using dotnet new
node.description: How to create project templates using dotnet new and the template.json file. How to share project templates by creating NuGet packages.

node.title: Colorful.Console
node.description: Colorful.Console is a C# library that wraps around the System.Console class, making your console apps more colourful. Write ASCII art using Figlet fonts.

node.title: Logging with Serilog.Exceptions
node.description: Log exception details and custom properties that are not output in Exception.ToString() using Serilog.Exceptions for .NET.

node.title: Portable Class Library (PCL) version of NotificationsExtensions NuGet package
node.description: NotificationsExtensions.Portable is a Portable Class Library (PCL) used to Create Windows 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.1 Tile, Toast and Badge Notification XML.
